required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Trial to Evaluate Safety and Efficacy of Ultherapy™ System for Lifting Skin on the Neck
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Trial to Evaluate Safety and Efficacy of Ultherapy™ System for Lifting Skin

brief_summary.textblock: Study is a prospective clinical trial to evaluate the efficacy of the Ulthera® System to improve Lifting Skin on the Neck. Changes from baseline in the FACE-Q Appraisal of Neck scale score and Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale scores will be assessed at study follow-up visits.

detailed_description.textblock:
Before Treatment:
The subject's eligibility (inclusion/exclusion criteria) will be assessed, and all subjects will check the FACE-Q Appraisal of Neck scale score
Treatment:
The Investigator will apply to the eligible subject the Study Device Ultherapy™ System with 200~260 lines of 3.0 and 4.5 probe respectively on the subject's neck.
Post-Treatment:
All subjects will visit the Institution at 12 weeks from the day of procedure, and will take photos of the neck. Efficacy evaluation will performed by the Photographic Evaluator.

primary_outcome.measure: Investigator Assessment of Improvement at 12 weeks post-treatment
primary_outcome.description: Investigator complete Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale at 12 weeks post-treatment by comparing subject's photographs

secondary_outcome.measure: Subject Assessment of Improvement at 12 weeks post-treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects complete a Patient Assessment Global Aesthetic Improvement Scale at 12 weeks posttreatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Subjects' Assessment of Pain during treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Subjects were assessed for the duration of study treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Pain score record using a Numeric Rating Scale (NRS,0-10) , with 0 representing no pain and 10 representing the worst pain possible.

intervention.description: The Investigator will apply to the eligible subject the Study Device Ultherapy™ System with 200~260 lines of 3.0 and 4.5 probe respectively on the subject's neck.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female, aged 30 to 65 years.
- Subject in good health
- Subjects who desire improvement in neck skin
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of an active systemic infectious disease
- general disease or skin disorder in the area to be treated
- Pregnant or lactating subjects
- Previous episode of facial or neck surgery for wrinkle correction
- Subjects who have aesthetic addiction, drug abuse, alcohol abuse
- Subjects who were treated Botox or Filler at the neck area
- Subjects who had Auto-Immune disease
